title: Freddie Prinze Jr joins Punky Brewster sequel pilot after dropping out of role in Nancy Drew series
text:
It might be hard to believe for any child of the '90s that teen heartthrob Freddie Prinze Jr is now taking on dad roles.

The actor recently dropped out of the role of Nancy Drew's father in the CW series, which recently premiered.

But now he's taking on another patriarch in the Punky Brewster sequel pilot, set for NBC's upcoming Peacock streaming platform, which launches next April.

Casting announcement: Freddie Prinze Jr has been cast in the Punky Brewster sequel pilot, set for NBC's upcoming Peacock streaming platform, which launches next April

He's been cast as Travis, the titular character's ex-husband and father of her three children.

The character is a working musician who's constantly in and out of town, although he remains a great father and even still has some chemistry with his ex.

He joins Soleil Moon Frye, who revives her titular role from the NBC series she starred in from 1984 to 1988, in addition to producing the new series.

Cherie Johnson also returns to her role from the original series, which was also named Cherie.

Daddy vibes: He plays Travis, the titular character's ex-husband and father of her three children

Punky's back: He joins Soleil Moon Frye, who revives her titular role from the NBC series she starred in from 1984 to 1988, in addition to producing the new series

Friends forever: Cherie Johnson also returns to her role from the original series, which was also named Cherie

The parent series starred Frye as the seven-year-old, whose mom abandons her and her dog at a supermarket.

Instead of ending up in an orphanage, she's taken in by Chicago photographer Henry Warnimont.

The sequel series will follow a grown-up Punky, who's now a single mother-of-three, trying to get her life back on track.

She soon meets a young woman named Izzy, who reminds her a lot of her younger self.

Chosen family: The parent series starred Frye as the seven-year-old, whose mom abandons her and her dog at a supermarket, before she's taken in by Chicago photographer Henry Warnimont

All grown up: The sequel series will follow a grown-up Punky, who's now a single mother-of-three, trying to get her life back on track

Frye recently told TooFab of the new series: 'It is my dream come true, this really is my dream come true, I love Punky Brewster so much.

'I always say that I didn't really know where Punky ended and I began because we were the same in so many ways and I believed it so much then and I believe it so much now.'

Prinze found fame in the '90s, starring in movies like She's All That and I Know What You Did Last Summer, where he met wife Sarah Michelle Gellar.
description: He's been cast as Travis, the titular character's ex-husband and father of her three children. He joins Soleil Moon Frye, who revives her role from the NBC series, which ran from 1984 to 1988.
